alert.note: Alert for Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 11:30AM EDT until May 02 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central New Jersey...and southern New Jersey... including the following counties...in central New Jersey... Monmouth. In southern New Jersey...Ocean. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1129 AM EDT, river gauge reports indicated water levels were still above flood stage along the Manasquan and North Branch Metedeconk Rivers. This is in response to the 5 to 7 inches of rain which fell over the weekend. - For Manasquan at Allenwood: At 11:15am the stage was 15.04 feet. Flood Stage is 14.5 feet. ... For N. Branch Metedeconk River at Lakewood: At 11:15am the stage was 8.08 feet. Flood Stage is 8 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
